entries.text: Stayed at the office until 10pm again. Everyone else left at 6. My manager didn't even ask me to stay late - I just can't leave work undone. Why am I like this?
Checking emails before I even get out of bed. Already anxious about today's presentation. Spent 6 hours on slides that took everyone else 2. It's still not perfect. It's never perfect.
Presentation went fine. Got good feedback. So why do I feel like a failure? Keep replaying the one question I fumbled. Nobody else probably even noticed. My brain is exhausting.
Therapy session was tough. Talked about how my self-worth is tied to productivity. Therapist asked 'what would happen if you weren't perfect?' Honestly? It terrifies me.
Tried the homework - left work at 5:30pm. Felt guilty the entire evening. Keep thinking about the emails I didn't answer. This is supposed to get easier, right?
Said 'no' to taking on an extra project. First time ever. My manager was fine with it. Why did I think the world would end if I set a boundary?
Weird realization: I've been running from something my whole life. Not towards success, but away from feeling 'not good enough.' Therapy is showing me I've been fighting the wrong battle.
